timeline.bodyText: This is a notification title which should not be too long. Otherwise last part of it will be replaced by  "..."
timeline.author: TobiGr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -529,7 +529,7 @@
     <string name="auto">Auto</string>
     <string name="switch_view">Switch View</string>
     <!-- App update notification -->
-    <string name="app_update_notification_content_title">NewPipe Update Available!</string>
+    <string name="app_update_notification_content_title">There is a fresh NewPipe version available!</string>

replies.bodyText:
The shortest alternative is "New NewPipe available" (?)
Or, "New NewPipe in the pipe."
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText: imo "NewPipe Update Available!" sounds fine. This change should be reverted.
replies.author: cool-student

replies.bodyText: @cool-student The problem is with update/upgrade. In Debian that is an upgrade, but some are calling it an update.
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText: There is no way to determine if it's an Update or Upgrade since one would need to know what changed each version.
replies.author: cool-student

replies.bodyText: That is yet another way to interpret update/upgrade, when "new version" does away with the confusion.
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText: What about "New NewPipe version available!"
replies.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: I would argue that Update has enough expressive power especially when you consider that most people aren't power users and these casual users will understand what an Update is. There is no such difference of Update or Upgrade for the typical user.
replies.author: cool-student

replies.bodyText: So since I found a way to express it to all users, that some of them are not affected is a good reason to trip the others up? It is very plausible you could update something else in NewPipe, like the video lists, subscriptions, etc.
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText:
Please keep the old one, because this is text for a notification and there is only limited space for notification headings.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="app_update_notification_content_title">There is a fresh NewPipe version available!</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="app_update_notification_content_title">NewPipe Update Available!</string>
replies.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="donation_encouragement">NewPipe is developed by volunteers spending time bringing you the best experience. Give back to help make NewPipe even better.</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="donation_encouragement">NewPipe is developed by volunteers spending their free time bringing you the best user experience. Give back to help developers make NewPipe even better while they enjoy a cup of coffee.</string>
          
      
    
    
  

removing the coffee here is imo not a good idea since the idea is that the cup of coffee IS THE DONATION also it's like that in other languages so it would be odd to only remove the cup of coffee here.
timeline.author: cool-student
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -355,7 +355,7 @@
     <string name="github_url" translatable="false">https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe</string>
     <string name="view_on_github">View on GitHub</string>
     <string name="donation_title">Donate</string>
-    <string name="donation_encouragement">NewPipe is developed by volunteers spending time bringing you the best experience. Give back to help developers make NewPipe even better while enjoying a cup of coffee.</string>
+    <string name="donation_encouragement">NewPipe is developed by volunteers spending time bringing you the best experience. Give back to help make NewPipe even better.</string>

replies.bodyText: Because it is tax exempt? I think people understand who are users, and who are developers. I don't understand the psychology you are going for, could you elaborate?
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText: so the idea is that coffee is cheap and people buy themselves coffee every day so to help out the project they can contribute by giving the equivalent of a coffee as a donation. The user / developers thing is not that important here.
replies.author: cool-student

replies.bodyText:
That idea doesn't work on people that have no relation to coffee. I agree that people spend more on things they hold dear, so it is indeed true the cost of a priority diminishes. My idea with that is to allude to it, and then play it into the added value by also tying it to NewPipe.
"Treat the NewPipe makers to something you like, by way of funding its development."
Could personify "NewPipe makers" more, but I think this is better. Going with @cool-student version for now.
replies.author: comradekingu

timeline.bodyText: I don't like this change
timeline.author: cool-student
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -557,7 +557,7 @@

     <string name="error_path_creation">The destination folder can not be created</string>
     <string name="error_permission_denied">Permission denied by the system</string>
-    <string name="error_ssl_exception">Secure connection failed</string>
+    <string name="error_ssl_exception">Could not connect securely</string>

replies.bodyText: Why? It is consistent with the other types of errors.
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText: personally "Secure connection failed" sounds better to me but I guess this is subjective.
replies.author: cool-student

replies.bodyText: @cool-student Sounding better or not, you can't really tell from that whether it is a current secure connection that fails, or establishing it that fails. Give that a shake through translation, and now it is the wrong one, only in a different language.
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText: But then it becomes a garden path sentence. You have to read to the end to get an idea of what is going on.
replies.author: comradekingu

replies.bodyText:
I think that's the case either way since this sentence has 2 parts that the user needs to understand, so if the user reads only the first half they will be confused but that's the case in your version as well, that is if I stop reading after "Using background player" I as a User will be confused but then why wouldn't I read the whole sentence ? So I restructured the sentence from if(condition) this happens to this happens if (condition) imo perfectly understandable if you don't stop reading midway.
In any case I think that the original line was good too your new version imo makes the sentence slightly awkward unless the purpose was specifically to make it more concise due to size constraints on certain devices with small screens or something like that.
replies.author: cool-student

replies.bodyText: I like @cool-student's suggestion. Thanks

@@ -355,7 +355,7 @@
     <string name="github_url" translatable="false">https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe</string>
     <string name="view_on_github">View on GitHub</string>
     <string name="donation_title">Donate</string>
-    <string name="donation_encouragement">NewPipe is developed by volunteers spending time bringing you the best experience. Give back to help developers make NewPipe even better while enjoying a cup of coffee.</string>
+    <string name="donation_encouragement">Treat the newPipe makers to something you like, by way of funding its development.</string>

replies.bodyText:
Done. However it adds two burdens on the user. One is the implied debt of having already received the software. That may work, but I don't like it.
The second is that of reading that long line of text. If done, that incurs an investment of time, which I also don't like, and really grinds my goat. It is not elegant. #2938 (comment)
replies.author: comradekingu

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be reverted. It is missing the "focus gain" information
timeline.author: Stypox
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -100,21 +100,21 @@
     <string name="enable_playback_state_lists_summary">Show playback position indicators in lists</string>
     <string name="settings_category_clear_data_title">Clear data</string>
     <string name="enable_watch_history_summary">Keep track of watched videos</string>
-    <string name="resume_on_audio_focus_gain_title">Resume on focus gain</string>
-    <string name="resume_on_audio_focus_gain_summary">Continue playing after interruptions (e.g. phone calls)</string>
+    <string name="resume_on_audio_focus_gain_title">Resumed playing</string>

replies.bodyText:
I prefer @comradekingu's change because I do not think that the "focus gain" info is valuable for the user. What is the difference between "Resume on focus gain" and "Resumed playing" form a user's viewpoint? I think "resumed playing" is a better title for the setting because it tells you what the setting is about: resume a paused video or audio. The info when this is triggered is placed in the description.
But using "Resume on focus gain" can raise several questions when seeing this for the first time: Resume what? What is a focus gain?
replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: Well, via, by and per are all correct here. Tbh I prefer via (although it is often used in formal context).
replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: Per is correct, but it is American-ish. So I'd use either by or via

replies.bodyText: I suggest "Report this error via e-mail". It is the most descriptive and straightforward.
